childElements.name: ApplicationInstructions
childElements.propertySetConfig:
{ "controlWidth" : 12, "label" : "TextBlock1", "text" : "

ARIZONA SUPREME COURT

Legal Document Preparer Individual - Initial Registration Instructions

Please read all the following instructions carefully before proceeding. There are several supporting documents listed below which must accompany the online submission. It is recommended that these documents are prepared and assembled prior to beginning the on online application process. To obtain additional assistance, contact the Certification and Licensing Division at LDP@courts.az.gov or visit the Arizona Judicial Department website at https://www.azcourts.gov/cld/Legal-Document-Preparer-Program.

  1. Fees:
    Please refer to ACJA § 7-208(K) to reference the applicable NON-REFUNDABLE fee(s) which are required to submit this application.

  2. Photograph:
    Applicant must upload one color passport-size photograph, two inches by two inches of the head, neck and shoulders only. The photograph must have been taken within the last two years and clearly identify the applicant.

  3. Education: 
    Though applicants are required to indicate educational history on this application, applicant will only need to upload documentation (in the Documents Section) for the highest level of education achieved. However, a photocopy of all other certificates or licenses listed, as well as Letters of Good Standing are still required.

  4. Fingerprint Cards: 
    A standard FBI fingerprint card is forwarded to applicants with the notice of passing score on the program exam. This card must be completed and returned to the Division via US mail. If the fingerprints are not clear, the card will be rejected and require resubmission. The $22.00 (subject to change) FBI processing fee is included with this application fee. Please fill out the sections of the card as indicated in the exam letter.

  5. Proof Citizenship/Legal Residency Acceptable Documents:
    Please upload CLEAR and READABLE copies. Failure to do so may result in a delay in processing the application. Please refer to the List of Acceptable Residency/Citizenship Documents on the Resource Center page of the Certification and Licensing Portal.

  6. Assumed Name (or D.B.A.):
    While conducting legal document preparer business, a certificate holder shall use the name as shown on the certificate and shall not transact business in this state under an assumed name or under any designation, name or style, corporate or otherwise, other than the real name of the individual unless the individual files with Division staff a license setting forth the name under which business will be transacted.

  7. Background Information:
    If applicant answers “Yes” to any question in the Background Section of this application, applicant is required to submit a SIGNED statement describing in detail all incidents including (1) names of all parties involved, (2) dates and locations, (3) the names and localities of any courts and/or administrative agencies involved, (4) the disposition of each matter, (5) whether the conviction, plea or finding was for a felony, misdemeanor, or open-ended charge.

  8. Authorization and Release:
    This form must be signed, notarized and uploaded with the application. Please refer to the legal document preparer program link on the Resource Center page of the Certification and Licensing Portal to access the form.

 

Questions? Call us at (602) 452-3378 or Email us at ldp@courts.az.gov

 
", "show" : null, "dataJSON" : false, "HTMLTemplateId" : "", "textKey" : "", "sanitize" : false }
